headline: Easy Cheese Ball II
description: Ranch dressing mix lends an herb-y tang to this cream cheese and cheddar combo; the crunch comes from chopped pecans.

video.description: See how to make a 5-star cheese ball with Cheddar and cream cheese.
video.name: Easy Cheese Ball II

name: Easy Cheese Ball II

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium size bowl, mash cream cheese. Mix dressing mix and Cheddar cheese into the cream cheese. Shape the mixture into a ball. Roll the ball in the chopped nuts. Refrigerate covered until ready to serve. Yum!

review.reviewBody: So good! As is this is a great, simple recipe. I like to change things to my taste the more often I make a recipe. I added a few pieces of chopped crispy bacon and garlic powder, as well as mixing in a handful of the chopped pecans when I mixed it together. I pressed it into a pie plate and topped it with the chopped pecans. Really delicious!
This was easy and tasty. I had all the ingredients on hand and it made for a good snack. I did cut the recipe in half and didn’t use the nuts.

i used a smaller diced nut that i found in a store that was the only change i made i made this for my sons 25th Birthday party and it was great everybody loved it and it was so easy to make i would recommend it for any party . Country50

This was good but I think it could have been more flavorful. I did add a couple of splashes of Worcestershire sauce as some of the reviews suggested but maybe next time add a bit more-or even more Ranch mix. I divided it into 2 cheese balls and froze one for another use. I also mixed with a hand beater because I wasn’t getting anywhere trying to blend everything by hand. I also toasted the pecans first.
We covered the outside of ours with green onions.
This is a fabulous recipe. Simple and quick to make. It is definitely a keeper.

Easy & Crowd Pleaser!
Based on other reviews I used premade ranch salad dressing and made it a day ahead. I also used crumbled bacon instead of pecans. Wow!!
Excellent cheese ball recipe, easy to make ad my guest love it. There is never any left
Love this recipe! only change was adding Worcestershire sauce. We made it for a Halloween party, shaped like a spider and it was a hit!

I added 3 pieces of crumbled bacon as another reviewer suggested and made it a day ahead. Taste was fabulous! Also, since this was made for a woodland themed baby shower, the cheeseball was made into the shape of a hedgehog and decorated with sliced almonds and peppercorns for the eyes and nose.
Excellent, however I did substitute onion and garlic powder since I didn't have ranch dressing mix. Was delicious and not too salty since the powders did not have salt.
I made this and used real bacon bits instead of the chopped pecans. My daughter and I loved it and will definitely be making it again. ??
Surprised it’s rated so high. Recipe is way too salty from the ranch dressing mix.
I made this according to the recipe. It makes a HUGE ball. It is so easy to prepare a day or two ahead. I will make this again, but I might cut the ingredients in half, depending on the crowd.
It was delish!!!!!!

This is a salt bomb. No way can you eat anything salty with it or even put bacon in it. I only used 1/2 of the ranch dip with 2 blocks of cream cheese, and 1 cup of cheddar.. I am going to serve it with raw veggies to try and salvage it. Yuk

This tasted good, and was easy to make - but was way too stiff even after sitting out at the party. I agree with other reviews that you don't need the entire package of ranch, it is very salty. I used half to 3/4 of it, and made it the night before so flavors could meld. Make sure to use sturdy crackers!
The easiest and the best to make. Everyone loves this
I can’t find where I have put favorites. Nots times I don’t even get the search bar.
I made this with Hidden Valley ranch mix and substituted bacon bits for the nuts. It was easy to make and a hit at the party. It really makes a lot though, I will cut it in half next time.
I leave the pecans off, and roll this in bacon bits sometimes. Very easy and very yummy!
I thought the flavor was good. Just way to salty for my taste buds. All I could taste was salt.
Very good made it with real bacon, finely minced green onion also added some garlic powder .love the triscuits with this
I would make it again, but do the smaller portion of it. We did this for superbowl 52 and it was good.

A little late reviewing but using this recipe again for New Year's. I first used it at Halloween instead of pecans I covered it in crushed Doritos and put a celery stick on the top for an adorable and tasty pumpkin. EVERYONE loved it!
A big hit! As suggested. I used bacon bits instead of pecans and found spicy ranch dressing mix. Everyone loved it. Definitely a keeper.
This was super easy to make and my guests enjoyed it. I added in bacon pieces which gave it a small boost of flavor.

Quick, easy and delicious! Made this for Christmas Eve and it was a showstopper! The ranch adds a tangy flavor that doesn’t overwhelm the cheese. I used freshly grated sharp cheddar and it was delicious!
I made this for a holiday party and everybody loved it. I made it the day before and used real bacon bits. Delicious
Have shared this recipe several times with friends...it is a hit. And once I take it to an annual potluck gathering, I have been asked to bring it again.

First time cheese ball maker! Only four stars being as I tweaked it. This recipe is super simple and very tasty! I followed other reviewers advice right off that bat because it sounded like it would fit our tastes a little better. I only used 3/4pk of dry Ranch dressing mix and rolled the chilled cheese ball in real bacon bits vs nuts (because everything's better w/bacon right?). Everyone was impressed and I've been writing down the four ingredient recipe and handing it out left and right. This will definitely be on the appetizer table this Thanksgiving (w/Ritz crackers) and many get togethers to come. Thanks!
So easy and what a hit. Don't forget to toast the pecans.
Absolutely delicious and a HUGE hit at a company party :) Will be making this a regular recipe in my arsenal
Great recipe! I did mix in real bacon and rolled it in toasted pecans. This cheese ball did not last long in my house!
This is a keeper! It's so easy to make & everyone always wants the recipe!
Love this! Easy and the grandkids love it! Yay!!

Heck, all these reviews saying it was too salty with the one packet of ranch. I thought it needed more! But it was wonderful regardless. I made it as written, but I added about a 1/2 packet more of the ranch dressing
I think I'd like to roll it up in bacon pieces next time. I bet it would be even better. good as is though. I spread the cheese on cucumber slices.
His was super easy and everyone loved it! I shaped mine into a porcupine for my daughter's woodland themed baby shower. It was so cute!

I just made my first cheese ball, which was way easier than I ever imagined. I used a cup and a half sharp cheddar (preshredded) and a cup a cup or so shredded pepper jack (block). I cut and cooked 6 slices of thick cut cherrywood bacon and added it to the cheese mixture along with a splash or two of Worcestershire sauce and Louisiana hot sauce and the whole package of ranch mix. Follow a few others recommendations, I'll be rolling it after it sits for a bit, in some chopped pecans. Can't wait!

Super easy + many compliments = a great recipe. 
Made as listed but added 1 extra C cream cheese to tone down the saltiness of the ranch dressing. Added a handful of chopped green onion. I mixed everything by hand didn't even need the mixer. This yielded three cheese balls. Took one to two different parties and froze one. Served it with pretzel crisps and sliced apples. Everyone loved it and wanted the recipe.
I've made this several times. It is a big hit and never any left. I usually half the recipe when I make it.

This is the First cheese ball that I ever made and it turned out great. The only change was to leave out 1 tbsp of the Ranch dsg and added one green onion per other viewers suggestions.
Also, I only needed two cups of shredded Cheddar cheese.
I actually got Two cheese balls out of this recipe. I will make it again. Thanks!
So simple, delicious, and easy to adapt to different variations! This gets devoured every where I bring it!
Fussy kid approved!
Turned out great made two one with real bacon bits and one with budding ham chopped. The one with bacon I added a tablespoon of bacon grease added to the favor
As others have said, it is very salty. And yes, it did sit overnight in the fridge. Unfortunately, ended up throwing most of it out.

This was a really good cheese ball and my guests all enjoyed it immensely. The only thing I omitted was the nuts, as I was making this into an igloo to use with the olive penguins. I "iced" the igloo with leftover whipped cream cheese used in the penguins.

I tried this recipe for the first time earlier this month. I served it at a party and it was a hit. It was easy to make too, so I made it for another party a few days later and hit the jack pot once again! A couple of weeks later, I made it for Christmas Eve and have now decided that this is my new "go-to" party contribution. The ingredients are few and inexpensive and the prep is easy! This cheese ball pairs well with Triscuit Thin Crisps. I highly recommend this recipe!
I made this but I used bacon and it was great!

I split the cheese mixture into 2 portions. One I added more herbs and rolled in basil for the vegetarians and the other I added 1/4 cup of bacon and rolled it in bacon. Both were hits! :)
Oh... I also wore nitrile gloves so I could really mix it together without loosing any under my nails! :)

This recipe is so simple and the cheese ball has excellent flavor. I made this for a company potluck. Everyone loved it!! The only thing I did different was roll the cheese ball over sliced almonds instead of pecans. Will definitely be making this again.

I make this all the time. I never have left overs and everyone loves it. Even the people who say they don't like cheese balls. The only change I make is, I use Colby Jack instead of Cheddar. I have had people request I bring it to their events. Super simple and absolutely delicious!
Was very tasty. I did not have pecans so I skipped that part but this was very tasty with my celery sticks.
Super easy to make and very yummy.

I did not use ranch . I added chives , green onions, paprika, garlic powder, parsley, dill weed , real bacon torn into bits , I rolled into ball and coated it in walnuts pecans and almonds ( all were toasted in oven ) . Thanks for the great base recipe for all to build upon .
I used the Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix and it was just too strong. I've had much better tasting cheese balls. Gave it two stars because it was quick and easy.
So easy to Make! I have made this exact recipe for 4 years now, everyone always request it at Thanksgiving
I added bits of bacon I fried up, this gives the recipe that additional oomph! Everyone loves it and I always get requests for the recipe. So glad I tried it, thanks for sharing.

Its ok... I only used less than half pack of ranch after reading the reviews and whew! Its way too ... "Ranchy"?? Unless that's your aim, I would only use a teaspoon of the ranch, two tops.
I also added yellow and green onions.

This was a very simple yet pretty tasty cheese ball! I fixed it per the recipe but as others have mentioned, make it beforehand and let sit in the fridge. I tasted it right after I made it and wow.... All I tasted was the Ranch seasoning mix. Bleh. However, I made it a day before my party and its amazing how much better it tasted the next day. The seasoning mix disappaited and was absorbed into the cream cheese so it was much milder. My party guests really enjoyed it!

This simple cheese ball is a party favorite in my family. I combine the cheeses/ranch mix the day before and let it rest in the refrigerator overnight. The next day, I roast the chopped pecans (makes a huge difference in the flavor profile) and roll the cheese ball in the nuts shortly before serving. (This way, the flavors of the cheese ball have a chance to meld, but the nuts stay crunchy and crisp.) Hint: Bring your cheese ball to room temperature before you roll it in the nuts (the cheese will become a little tacky and help the nuts stick to the ball).
Excellent as it is
Amazing !!!!!!
Easy and good. Used bacon bits instead of nuts and only used ¾ of the seasoning.
Added chopped green onions, red and green pepper. Did not use Ranch powder, but a few tablespoons of Ranch dressing.
Made this for co workers and EVERYONE LOVED IT! Really good and easy to make, first cheese ball I've ever made. next time I will experiment with adding to it.
Yes I would make it again but I would use Gourmet DipKits Cheezy Bleu Cheeze Spices instead of the Ranch stuff which is way too salty. Gourmet DipKits can be ordered from www.GourmetDipKits.com.
We made this cheese ball tonight and we all loved it!! My new favorite cheese ball! So happy we tried it. I added parsley to give it more color and we rolled ours in slithered almonds. Loved it!!!

Love, love, love this cheese ball. I make it every year during the holidays for my neighbors a nice change from sweets. We do like it best rolled in bacon and I add a few dashes of Worcestershire and sometimes some chili flakes for the neighbors that can take a little heat
I carried this to work, and it was a hit. Several asked for the recipe. I did follow someone's review and rolled the cheese ball in bacon bits. It was a nice change over the usual pecans.

I made this last night for our work Christmas snack day! It was delicious and a huge hit by all. I did cut back on the amount of Ranch Dressing mix, I added about 3/4 of the packet. And instead of rolling the ball in pecans I used real bits of bacon. I'll definitely make this again!!

This received a high five at my Christmas gathering with friends. Made a few minor additions/changes: only used half of the 1 oz. ranch packet, added 3 tblsps of goat cheese, added 2 tblsps of honey (of offset the strong salty favors). I will definitely make this again!
Great tasting and easy to make!
This is wonderfully flavorful and easy to make. I mixed a few different cheeses that I had on hand but mostly sharp cheddar. Had to give recipe to friends.

Well this recipe started out with me not softening the cream cheese, but that's ok i read the directions about how to soften in the microwave. What I noticed that I should have definitely done was mix the cream cheese till it got to a whipped texture and then add the ranch dressing , I just dumped the package on top of the cream cheese and then started stirring and it did not mix well. Then I noticed that i should shredded my own cheese and not used the pre shredded kind it does not mix well.
This is easy to make. I used chili powder instead of ranch and smoked cheddar (I smoked myself). Covered with crushed honey roasted nuts.

Delicious cheese ball and easy to make. I did use about 1/4 stick extra of cream cheese because I was worried about several remarks regarding the saltiness. I refrigerated it overnight in an airtight container and then pressed the chopped pecans onto it just before serving.

I make this all the time and my friends LOVE it... I have made several alterations... I add smoked paprika to give the base cheese a smokey flavor... then remove 1/2 of the mixture set aside. To the remaining 1/2 I add jalapeños, banana peppers, cayenne, chipotle in adobe, habaneros... whatever pepper you like - my friends like it hot. 

To the original batch I add additional smoked paprika to the nuts (and I usually use smoked almonds because I buy them in bulk)... for the Hot pepper version I add chipotle chili powder to the nut mixture. YUM!!!

I also form more of a log so you get more nuts/smokey flavor in each bite.

Everyone loved it! I didn't have ranch mix so instead I added about a teaspoon dried chives, teaspoon dried parsley, 3/4 t. onion powder, ground black pepper and a dash of cayenne and some chopped green onion. Used Kraft triple cheddar shredded cheese. Rolled in both roasted pecan bits and cripsy bacon. Made two cheeseballs. Each feeds 8-10 for an appetizer.

So easy and so good. I've made this a couple times now. I only use 2 cups of cheese (because I buy the pre shredded and they come in pkgs of 2 cups). This is a good base for additional add ons. I've also made it with bacon and green onions. I've also used a Mexican style cheese. This is definitely a keeper.
I got pretty good reviews on this at a family gathering. I think it needs a bit or worcestershire sauce and sharp cheddar.

This lived up to its name. Easy and cheesy. I actually substituted flavored whipped cream cheese for the regular cream cheese and dressing mix. It was super easy to put together that way, and I don't have to worry about the flavors being distributed evenly.
Made for a family gathering. No leftovers.

This cheeseballs is amazing! I tripled the recipe for a wedding, and it yielded 10 mid-sized cheeseballs! They were so good, I bought more ingredients to make for my husband and I to enjoy with some wine. Will definitely be making again!!
Let the cream cheese soften before attempting to mix it! Fabulous! Everyone could not get enough of this!
Tasted too salty.
Tried this recipe for thanks giving. It was a huge success! Thanks!!!!

I made this for New Year's Eve. It was amazing - everyone loved it. I did add 6 strips of cooked, crumbled bacon bccause my husband loves bacon and I skipped the pecans because he is not so fond of them. But I am sure it would be just as amazing made as directed.

I used cheddar cheese and 1/2 of a ranch dip packet. I will try this next time using a ranch dressing (not dip) packet. I liked it, but the seasoning/salt flavour was pretty intense, even the next day.
I did not care for this recipe. Followed recipe to a t. This is very salty and tastes like ranch dressing mix.

This was a real hit at Christmas and I had multiple requests for the recipe. I made a double batch of this and used some of it to make a ball exactly as written for my vegetarian guests. They loved it! I divided the rest into smaller balls with crispy bacon bits (the real thing). The bacon version flew off the table and I had to replace with another ball after only 20 minutes! Some of my guests were also spreading this on celery sticks from my veggie tray. I'm glad I made extra!

Great recipe as is and is a fantastic base recipe for additional ingredients. I plan to experiment with fillings and coatings. Thanks!
Our household LOVES cheese so this was a perfect little treat! We used some Monterey Jack cheese and cheddar cheese, wonderful! We didn't have any left overs! Good for a football snack also!

6 years ago I found this recipe. I wanted to make a cheese ball for my appetizer table at Christmas. My family loved it! It's now a Christmas favorite and a tradition. The only change that I make is that I use real bacon pieces instead of pecans (thanks to another reviewer's suggestion). I also use only half of all of the ingredients because I need a smaller ball. But other than those two changes, I follow the recipe exaxtly as is and it's perfect!

Easy and good. I divided this into 2 balls and froze one for this upcoming weekend. Definitely would suggest letting it sit overnight. The day it was made before rolling it up I tried a tiny bite and wowza it was powerful, but after sitting all night it was mellowed out some. Next time I think I will cut back on the ranch as it was just a bit to much. Other than that won't change anything. Thanks for the easy recipe.
Delicious. Bacon not necessary.

Very good! Dressing mix....picked up dip mix by mistake but read reviews and used about half a packet....had mild cheddar cheese and it was just too mild so I added: Sharp shredded cheddar cheese and about 8 ounces of crushed pineapple. Rolled in chopped pecans. When I tried it last night it seemed like nothing special BUT today the flavors had mingled and it is superb!!! Not much left after a morning Advent gathering. Thanks for sharing!

Such an easy thing to make and you can change it up with what you have. I've cut up ham or turkey before and added that into it, and used several different types of nuts on the outside. I prefer crushed peanuts than the pecans.

The boy helped me make this for a potluck at work and I happen to work at the high school he attends. He was a big fan of our test samples and managed to stop by a couple of times during passing period and at lunch to "sample" some more. This was a big hit with my co-workers, some of them stating it was the best cheeseball they'd ever had...I certainly didn't come home with any leftovers! I followed the super-easy recipe as written and I am looking forward to making this for my family at our Christmas Eve party. Delish!!
